t: John 13
Jesus Washes His Disciples’ Feet
It*p was just before the Passover Festival. Jesus knew that the hour had come for him to leave this world and go to the Father. Having loved his own who were in the world, he loved them to the end.
The*p evening meal was in progress, and the devil had already prompted Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, to betray Jesus.
Jesus knew that the Father had put all things under his power, and that he had come from God and was returning to God;
so he got up from the meal, took off his outer clothing, and wrapped a towel around his waist.
After that, he poured water into a basin and began to wash his disciples’ feet, drying them with the towel that was wrapped around him.
He*p came to Simon Peter, who said to him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
Jesus*p replied, “You*r do*r not*r realize*r now*r what*r I*r am*r doing,*r but*r later*r you*r will*r understand.”*r
“No,”*p said Peter, “you shall never wash my feet.” Jesus*p answered, “Unless*r I*r wash*r you,*r you*r have*r no*r part*r with*r me.”*r
“Then,*p Lord,” Simon Peter replied, “not just my feet but my hands and my head as well!”

Jesus*p answered, “Those*r who*r have*r had*r a*r bath*r need*r only*r to*r wash*r their*r feet;*r their*r whole*r body*r is*r clean.*r And*r you*r are*r clean,*r though*r not*r every*r one*r of*r you.”*r
For he knew who was going to betray him, and that was why he said not every one was clean.
When*p he had finished washing their feet, he put on his clothes and returned to his place. “Do*r you*r understand*r what*r I*r have*r done*r for*r you?”*r he asked them.
“You*r call*r me*r ‘Teacher’*r and*r ‘Lord,’*r and*r rightly*r so,*r for*r that*r is*r what*r I*r am.*r
Now*r that*r I,*r your*r Lord*r and*r Teacher,*r have*r washed*r your*r feet,*r you*r also*r should*r wash*r one*r another’s*r feet.*r
I*r have*r set*r you*r an*r example*r that*r you*r should*r do*r as*r I*r have*r done*r for*r you.*r
Very*r truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r no*r servant*r is*r greater*r than*r his*r master,*r nor*r is*r a*r messenger*r greater*r than*r the*r one*r who*r sent*r him.*r
Now*r that*r you*r know*r these*r things,*r you*r will*r be*r blessed*r if*r you*r do*r them.*r
Jesus Predicts His Betrayal

“I*rp am*r not*r referring*r to*r all*r of*r you;*r I*r know*r those*r I*r have*r chosen.*r But*r this*r is*r to*r fulfill*r this*r passage*r of*r Scripture:*r ‘He*r who*r shared*r my*r bread*r has*r turned*r against*r me.’*r
“I*rp am*r telling*r you*r now*r before*r it*r happens,*r so*r that*r when*r it*r does*r happen*r you*r will*r believe*r that*r I*r am*r who*r I*r am.*r
Very*r truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r whoever*r accepts*r anyone*r I*r send*r accepts*r me;*r and*r whoever*r accepts*r me*r accepts*r the*r one*r who*r sent*r me.”*r
After*p he had said this, Jesus was troubled in spirit and testified, “Very*r truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r one*r of*r you*r is*r going*r to*r betray*r me.”*r
His*p disciples stared at one another, at a loss to know which of them he meant.
One of them, the disciple whom Jesus loved, was reclining next to him.
Simon Peter motioned to this disciple and said, “Ask him which one he means.”
Leaning*p back against Jesus, he asked him, “Lord, who is it?”

Jesus*p answered, “It*r is*r the*r one*r to*r whom*r I*r will*r give*r this*r piece*r of*r bread*r when*r I*r have*r dipped*r it*r in*r the*r dish.”*r Then, dipping the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.
As soon as Judas took the bread, Satan entered into him. So*p Jesus told him, “What*r you*r are*r about*r to*r do,*r do*r quickly.”*r
But no one at the meal understood why Jesus said this to him.
Since Judas had charge of the money, some thought Jesus was telling him to buy what was needed for the festival, or to give something to the poor.
As soon as Judas had taken the bread, he went out. And it was night.
Jesus Predicts Peter’s Denial
When*p he was gone, Jesus said, “Now*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r glorified*r and*r God*r is*r glorified*r in*r him.*r
If*r God*r is*r glorified*r in*r him,*r God*r will*r glorify*r the*r Son*r in*r himself,*r and*r will*r glorify*r him*r at*r once.*r

“My*rp children,*r I*r will*r be*r with*r you*r only*r a*r little*r longer.*r You*r will*r look*r for*r me,*r and*r just*r as*r I*r told*r the*r Jews,*r so*r I*r tell*r you*r now:*r Where*r I*r am*r going,*r you*r cannot*r come.*r
“A*rp new*r command*r I*r give*r you:*r Love*r one*r another.*r As*r I*r have*r loved*r you,*r so*r you*r must*r love*r one*r another.*r
By*r this*r everyone*r will*r know*r that*r you*r are*r my*r disciples,*r if*r you*r love*r one*r another.”*r
Simon*p Peter asked him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus*p replied, “Where*r I*r am*r going,*r you*r cannot*r follow*r now,*r but*r you*r will*r follow*r later.”*r
Peter*p asked, “Lord, why can’t I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you.”
Then*p Jesus answered, “Will*r you*r really*r lay*r down*r your*r life*r for*r me?*r Very*r truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r before*r the*r rooster*r crows,*r you*r will*r disown*r me*r three*r times!*r
